comments:
I just added another project to the build path of my java project and now I am getting erratic debugging behaviour. When i try to step inside a function call, it jusmps to a random different file instead of the one containing the function.

After stopping the debugging, I see the following 2 errors in my error log.

Is there any quick remedy to cure this problem? I need this badly since i am in a middle of a project and i *need* to debug. I tried 'cleaning' and rebuilding the projects but that didnt help.

Errors -
Message - An exception occurred while dispatching debug events.
java.security.AccessControlException: access denied (java.lang.RuntimePermission modifyThread)
	at java.security.AccessControlContext.checkPermission(Unknown Source)
	at java.security.AccessController.checkPermission(Unknown Source)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.shutdown(Unknown Source)
	at antlr_Studio.debug.DebugServer.shutdown(Unknown Source)
	at antlr_Studio.debug.DbgServerMangaer.stopDebugServer(Unknown Source)
	at antlr_Studio.debug.DbgServerMangaer.onTerminateEvent(Unknown Source)
	at antlr_Studio.debug.DbgServerMangaer.handleDebugEvents(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.debug.core.DebugPlugin$EventNotifier.run(DebugPlugin.java:1076)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.SafeRunner.run(SafeRunner.java:37)
	at org.eclipse.debug.core.DebugPlugin$EventNotifier.dispatch(DebugPlugin.java:1108)
	at org.eclipse.debug.core.DebugPlugin$EventDispatchJob.run(DebugPlugin.java:344)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)

Message - Problems occurred when invoking code from plug-in: "org.eclipse.debug.core".


java.security.AccessControlException: access denied (java.lang.RuntimePermission modifyThread)
at java.security.AccessControlContext.checkPermission(Unknown Source)
at java.security.AccessController.checkPermission(Unknown Source)
at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.shutdown(Unknown Source)
at antlr_Studio.debug.DebugServer.shutdown(Unknown Source)
at antlr_Studio.debug.DbgServerMangaer.stopDebugServer(Unknown Source)
at antlr_Studio.debug.DbgServerMangaer.onTerminateEvent(Unknown Source)
at antlr_Studio.debug.DbgServerMangaer.handleDebugEvents(Unknown Source)
at org.eclipse.debug.core.DebugPlugin$EventNotifier.run(DebugPlugin.java:1076)
at org.eclipse.core.runtime.SafeRunner.run(SafeRunner.java:37)
at org.eclipse.debug.core.DebugPlugin$EventNotifier.dispatch(DebugPlugin.java:1108)
at org.eclipse.debug.core.DebugPlugin$EventDispatchJob.run(DebugPlugin.java:344)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)

I would suggest removing whatever plugin is providing the antlr_Studio.debug.* classes and restart Eclipse specifying -clean.

This plugin appears to be the root cause of the problem and is not part of the Eclipse debug framework.

When line numbers don't match the source it indicates the .class files are not in synch with the .java files. Either you need to re-build or see if you have multiple copies of the source in the workspace.

As i mentioned earlier, I have tried cleaning up the generated .class files and rebuilt the project from scratch.

Note that the 'PropertySheetPanel' class shown in the code snippet in my prior post is my class (not a system class). Its even in the same package as the file containing the 'main()' function. Yet I am getting problems stepping in.

I have even tried so much as creating a new workspace, new project and copying all the src files to it. But still the problem persists.

I definetly believe this is a at least a 'critical' level bug since i am unable to debug my propertysheetpanel class.

Can you provide a screen shot of the 'out-of-synch' line numbers - i.e. debug view and source file? Have you compiled with debug attributes on? How are you building the projecct - i.e. using Ant or JDT compiler (built-in) support?

Created an attachment (id=52843)
Screenshot of debugging the class

I am building the project the normal way 'with JDT'. Yes, the debugging attributes are set. 

Attached is the screenshot of me stepping inside the PropertySheetPanel() constructor. As you can see, it is showing the String class instead and the this variable shows PropertyEditorFactory instead of PropertySheetPanel.

The debugger has stepped into the class loader. When you step into your constructor, the VM has to load a class. Although you have step filters on, the default step filters are not filtering class loading completely.

Marking as a dup of bug 161416, which is an enhancement request to improve step filtering when class loading.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 161416 ***

I dont see how this is a step filtering issue, since the constructor doesnt make any use of the String class?

Also if is a step filtering issue, why is a 'comment' line highlighted and not a code line?
Also why doesnt it break into other classes like the 'ClassLoader' class too, why only the String class?

Sorry I didnt notice the comment in your last post.

Is there any way around this issue that will help me debug my program until the bug are resolved?

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 16416 ***

Simply do a step return from the String class, or add it to the step filters (i.e. turn on the step filter for "java.*").

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 161416 ***
